Merge branch 'qa-fix-haproxy'

pmdahaproxy: fix connect script handling of string quoting

From qa/1110 on rawhide
> $PCP_VAR_DIR/pmdas/haproxy/connect:60: SyntaxWarning: invalid escape sequence '\&'

Python 3.12 is producing errors on invalid escape sequences
embedded in strings on rawhide - use double-backslash which
seems to be the original intention here.

build: install some pmlogtools onto the default PATH

Several pmlog*tools have been traditionally installed into
the (internal) PCP_BINADM_DIR.  Move these to /usr/bin and
maintain the earlier path via symlinks as has been done in
the past to ensure we don't break existing installations -
this makes it easier for people to find these as sometimes
we do want to run them directly/interactively too, and not
exclusively via the automated pmlogger scripts.

Affects pmlogredact(1), pmlogreduce(1) and pmlogrewrite(1).

Fixed pcp-buddyinfo key issue with python2

python2 doesn't support f-string formatting
so changed it to the '%' string formatting so that it wroks
with both python2 and python3

Signed-off-by: sagar sagar <sagar.sagar@oracle.com>

man pages: jumbo change to map font CW -> CR

All triggered by some bozo in the groff-base package maintainer
group who decided to break 30+ years of compatibility by deciding
that the font CW is no longer an alias for the (completely wrongly
named) font CR (it is not in the Times Roman family!).

Sigh.
bash,zsh: completions for new -o option for pmie
pmie: missed new header file in last commit

pmie: add -o|--format option to control output format with archives

Since most rule actions are "fake" when processing performance data
from archives, the -o option provides some rudimentary control over
the format of the output messages when rule actions are executed.

The meta-fields supported in the -o option are (from pmie(1)) ...

   %a  The name of the action, e.g.  print, syslog, etc.
   %d  The  date  and  time  in ctime(3) format when the action would have
       been executed.
   %f  The name of the configuration file containing the action being exe‐
       cuted, else <stdin> if the rules were read from standard input.
   %l  The (approximate) line number in the configuration file for the ac‐
       tion being executed.
   %m  The message component of the action.
   %u  The date and time when the action would have been executed  in  ex‐
       tended ctime(3) format with microsecond precision for the time.
   %%  A literal percent character.

   The default output format is equivalent to a format of %a %d: %m.

Resolves https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp/issues/1799.

Merge commit '3d9899c40481d72b9d20fd43ee2f854a2ed4cea4' into pcp-htop-merge

pcp-htop: support for dynamic screen (user-configurable tabs)

This implements the concept of 'dynamic screens' in htop, with a
first use-case of pcp-htop displaying things like top-filesystem
and top-cgroups under new screen tabs.

From the pcp-htop side of things, dynamic screens are configured
using text-based configuration files that define the mapping for
PCP metrics to columns (and metric instances to rows).  Metrics
are defined either directly (via metric names) or indirectly via
PCP derived metric specifications.  Value scaling and the units
displayed is automatic based on PCP metric units and data types.

This commit represents a collaborative effort of several months,
primarily between Sohaib, BenBE and myself.

qa/326: stretch timings

This test has become unstable on some slower VMs because the
"do stuff in the back ground - sleep - whack pmcd - sleep ..."
logic has no explicit synchronization, so the background and
foreground activity becomes unaligned if execution of one
or the other is slowed.
Add tarball upload to release workflow

qa: bpf PMDA tests now _notrun if modules cannot be loaded

After a lot of patience and fruitless triage, I'm now whacking the bpf
PMDA QA so that if the BPF modules needed for a test cannot be loaded
the test will be _notrun.  The repeated failures of tests in this class
usually end up being some botch between the kernel, kernel modules,
libbpf or the toolchain ... in short nothing to do with the PCP code.
And the existing _notrun guards in the test cases are not sufficient
to detect these scenarios, so the tests fail.

Specifically the changes involve a new function _pmdabpf_tryload()
added to common.bpf which uses the (recently added) --tryload option
for pmdabpf to parse a config file and load the associated modules. If
this fails, _notrun() is called.

Then all the bpf PMDA test cases are modified to call
_pmdabpf_tryload() before trying to install the PMDA.

src/libpcp/src/secureconnect.c: improved SSL error reporting

Several changes here:

- in multiple places, do not allow silent error returns, but add
  conditional diagnostics guarded by -Dtls or -Dauth

- hook libpcp into the libssl trace mechanism SSL_trace() when
  -Dtls and -Ddesperate are in play (introduces another one-trip
  static)

- document in qa/712 how to use these hooks to debug failures in
  that test (the original trigger for all of this)

qa/common.secure: remove certificates after 360 days

Our QA certificates are only valid for one year, and after that
we have all manner of QA failures (712, 713, ...) that are nigh
on impossible to diagnose because the openssl library and libpcp
conspire to take the Schulz defence and "tell us nothing".

src/pmlogger/pmlogger_daily.sh: last part (I think) of $(date...) work

The previous commits had re-instated the behaviour of embedded shell
commands in the directory field of the control file, for example:
    /gpfs/data/root/pcp/$(date +%Y)/$(date +%m)/LOCALHOSTNAME/$(date +%Y)-$(date +%m)-$(date +%d)

What was not done was the work to make pmlogger_daily look in other
directories for archives to chew on, because they were hiding in
directories different from today's directory.

This commit fixes that.

There are a bunch of QA changes, mostly remade .out files as a result
of pmlogger_daily now using find(1) in places where ls(1) in the
current (today's) directory used to suffice ... this leads to some
different ordering in the sets of archives to be processed.

qa/1473 is new.

qa/870: cut systemctl some slack

When run with --check (as is the case from my check.callback), be more
lenient with systemctl and treat the state "activating" as the same as
"active", so don't report an error.

I've seen several cases where systemctl is "activating" and after
several seconds (4 or 5) is still waiting for the pmlogger lock as in
    pmsleep -w waiting for lock 0.1
is at the end of the systemctl process trace that starts with
pmlogger_check.

This is probably due to a timing collision between QA scripts and the
regular systemctl housekeeping for pmlogger, and until we have evidence
to the contrary should not cause a QA failure in the callback routine.

misc: retire "archive log" phrase

Last batch of changes for this one ... mostly QA.

qa and more docs: retire "archive log" phrase

Same as for earlier commits in this batch ...

We've been troubled by this for a long time ... the phrase "archive log"
is both needlessly wordy and confusing with "log" to mean something like
like pmcd.log or pmlogger.log.

    [PCP] archive log(s) -> [PCP] archive(s)
    log -> archive (where this is referring to an archive, not a log)

We're stuck with "log" as a verb, log as it appears in pmlogger configs
and pmlc commands and output, LOG in macro names and Log in PMAPI
routine names, but these things are not going to change in my lifetime.

pmlogconf: remove latency-inducing fsync on config write

The fsync during pmlogconf probe was originally added to
attempt to improve robustness.  However, it can have the
opposite effect - on a busy system (like after a package
upgrade across the OS), and during boot, it may induce a
slowdown that brings systemd service timeouts into play,
since its run during pmlogger service start.

It's hypothesized this is the root cause of BZ 2229441 -
a detailed valgrind-based forensic analysis has found no
possible cause within pmlogconf itself there.

Related to Fedora BZ 2229441.
pmlogconf: fix small memory leak during logging group teardown

pmieconf: update webhook action for better EDA integration

The pmieconf webhook action was initially created for Event
Driven Ansible (EDA); two issues have been resolved related
- using the JSON key "values" conflicts with something deep
down in EDA that also interprets this JSON.  Use "message",
which is more descriptive of the content anyway.
- there is no easily accessible hostname JSON key - add one
via the usual %h pmie action string expansion.

Related to Red Hat BZ #2185803

as part of the primary pmie startup and thats not whats needed
for this diagnostic rule.

pmdaopenmetrics: reduce transient instance logs, improve labels

Ensure an indicative error code is used that does not result
in openmetrics.log getting a diagnostic every time instances
vanish.  This is common with process_exporter, for example.

Perform less processing of quoting in labels so that we are
able to handle metric from the systemd_exporter sensibly and
without parse errors in libpcp (partially stripped escaping
is the root cause there).  Drop per-instance optional labels
as well as this just results in unhelpful duplicate text.

Finally, update QA to match, adding in a problematic systemd
case to the openmetrics regression samples.

src/pmlogconf/pmlogconf.c: diagnostic changes

- document appl0 and appl1 debug flag scope
- additional -Dappl1 diagnostics for "probe" operations
- when pmLookupName() fails with more than one name to lookup, report
  names of metrics
- when pmFetch() fails, report name and pmids of metrics
- when values hash lookup fails, report metric details
- when desc hash lookup fails, report metric details

src/pmlogger/pmlogger_check.sh: report when pmlogconf makes changes

Debugging aid when pmlogconf does not do what we expect.

src/pmcd/src/dopdus.c: correct function name in comment

Cut-n-paste botch.

qa: remake .out files for sample PMDA changes

In particular the new metrics sample.not_ready_msec and
sample.secret.family.

qa/1472: (new) start of notready-ready testing

Includes new qa/src/ready-or-not.c app.

qa/src/multithread9.c: changes to track sample PMDA changes

Specifically an additional metric below sample.secret.

sample PMDA changes

- correct comment in traverse_dynamic()
- add sample.not_ready_msec to provide millisecond control over
  notready-ready transitions (same semantics as sample.not_ready)
- add sample.secret.family to provide a dynamic metric with an instance
  domain (static instances and values)
- change limbo() to allow sub-second sleep between notready and ready
  transitions
- add notready-ready transitions on missing code paths: sample_pmid(),
  sample_name(), sample_children(),
- for dynamic metrics, add support for PM_ERR_NONLEAF (requested name
  is the prefix of the name of a dynamic metric, e.g. sample.secret)
- change sample.needprofile to return day of month, rather than
  <month>.<day of month> (as a float)

pmdagfs2: Update QA testing to newer fakeroot based testing method

Update the GFS2 PMDA testing to use the fakeroot based qa testing method,
this removes qa/gfs2.common qa/655 test cases and updates the qa/654 test
case to use enviroment variable injection and fakeroot archives to allow more
accessible testing of the PMDA in environments without a cluster setup.

pcp-meminfo.py : implemented graceful reporting of samples (v2)

Signed-off-by: Mohith Kumar Thummaluru <mohith.k.kumar.thummaluru@oracle.com>

pcp-atop: fix memory leak switching to bar graph mode (covscan)

Tackles the following covscan issue in a MBARGRAPH switch case:
>>>     CID 394863:  Resource leaks  (RESOURCE_LEAK)
>>>     Variable "curlist" going out of scope leaks the storage it points to.

qa: ensure all-ubuntu archive is in the installed set
docs: small tweaks to recent logrewrite updates

Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp

qa/1454,1459,1462,1464: avoid \ insanity with echo(1)

It would be really nice if echo(1) behaved the same way everywhere,
but no that's not what's happening.  echo on bozo is totally different
to echo on vm03, with respect to how "\2- \1" for example is reported.

Just avoid echo for the critical parts of these tests.
qa/364: dodge one more proc/hotproc metric that might not be there

qa/admin/list-packages: small changes

- drop useless -n command line option
- skip metadata refresh for dnf and yum
qa/1454 (and 1459): wrestle some unintended echo \<octal> escaping

qa/749: report how many times the probe was "hit"

Aid to debugging.

src/pmdas/linux/getinfo.c: fix SEGV when lsb-release is the only /etc/*-release file

Bug in get_distro_info() as triaged and fixed by Tim Guo(BJ-RD)
<TimGuo@zhaoxin.com>.

Ick (as per comment already in code) logic for lsb-release was null
terminating the array *after* dinking with the base address of the
array ... do the null termination first and the problem goes away.

Most of us have never seen this because at least one of the other
*-release files is found in /etc and we never get the the lsb-release
case.

qa: tidy up valgrind executable test

Need 2>&1 to dodge stderr from which(1) on BSD systems (at least)
when valgrind not installed.
ci: fix fedora rawhide setup, where dnf5 removed the -b option

To make qa/1370 happy.

Merge branch 'redact'
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/performancecopilot/pcp

qa: refactor valgrind tests

- if valgrind is available, do not run the non-valgrind variant of
  a test because this gives no extra coverage
- when valgrind is not available the non-valgrind variant will be
  run
- change touches a fair number of existing tests non-valgrind tests
  that have valgrind variants
- change the new-grind script to implement this change going forward
docs: bump release and note next planned release date
docs: update changelogs, add fedora BZ number to spec file
